channel.title: EPH on Quiet time notes
channel.description: Recent content in EPH on Quiet time notes

item.title: EPH 6
item.description: EPH 6:15 The Lord’s armour Vs the believer’s armour Related verses: Isaiah 59:17, Ephesians 6:14-15. See notes EPH 6:11 On a sidenote: “We dishonour God by breaking the law” - Romans 3:23 The full armour of God is enough to protect us from the devil’s attack. Belt of truth breastplate of righteousness shoes of the gospel of peace shield of faith - quench ALL fiery darts helmet of salvation sword of the spirit - word of God pray in the spirit The devil’s weapon is deception.

item.title: EPH 2
item.description: EPH 2:8 Noah found grace through faith. he was willing to believe against all odds that the prophecies of the flood was real and true and he took action Related verses: Genesis 6:8, Ephesians 2:8-9, Hebrews 11:7. See notes

item.title: EPH 4
item.description: EPH 4:3 Peace is a bond that causes unity Related verses: Ephesians 4:3. See notes

item.title: EPH 5
item.description: EPH 5:18 Wine gives a tipsy influence and you get drunk when you continue. You get the same influence with the Holy Spirit. He gives you a sweet influence. Related verses: Ephesians 5:18. See notes

item.title: EPH 1
item.description: EPH 1:18 Oh Lord, open my eyes that I may see Related verses: 2 KINGS 6:17, PSALM 119:18, EPHESIANS 1:18. See notes EPH 1:23 God’s plan was that the Jews first trust in Jesus then the gentiles. the good news saves people Related verses: Ephesians 1:12-23. See notes EPH 1:4 Paul an apostle of Jesus Christ through God’s will. The letter is addressed to faithful followers of Jesus Christ in Ephesus.

item.title: EPH 3
item.description: EPH 3:13 Tribulation brings glory Related verses: Ephesians 3:13. See notes
